Name: Last Aurora: Frozen Steel
Description:
Frozen Steel is the second expansion of Last Aurora.
The game introduces 5 independent modules (compatible with each other):

- 4 starting crew with asymmetrical abilities;
- a set of enemies, very powerful and hard to kill;
- a set of new exploration cards (vehicle, trailers, devices, survivors, events, encounters, objects with new powers and abilities);
- player versus player set, which let players to fight other Convoy;
- a deck of story cards, which introduce a narrative part during the game, in which player must face hard decisions, resolve missions and much more.

2023 Seal of Excellence by Dice Tower

Name: Darkpass
Description:
Darkpass is a collaborative campaign-based tabletop dungeon crawler that takes place in the dark and dismal 1854 Paris sewer system. The butcher, blacksmith, alchemist, and host of other characters combat a stream of ravenous beasts as they make their way through the grime and filth, deducing the best way to survive and forge ahead on their journey.

Players must work their way through each chamber by defeating beasts, collecting items and performing tasks. Characters and beasts take turns based on a determined initiative per chamber.

Characters and beasts move and take an action on each turn, through the use of action cards, which include attacks, resting, dashing and exploring.

Items can be collected with the explore action and used to manage obstacles and help defeat beasts.

Throughout the campaign, characters become stronger and more skilled as they progress through deeper, darker and more difficult chambers.

-description from publisher

Name: Not Alone: Sanctuary – Minerva-MK18
Description:
Promo Monster card for Not Alone: Sanctuary
Issued with Plato Magazine #133 (March 2021) for the French version. 
The English version came with the kickstarter campaign.

Avatar card
Minerva-MK18
Cyborg
Not Alone icon

EN :
Phase 3 : The lost of your last Will does not move the Assimilation counter forward.
FR : 
Phase 3 : la perte de votre dernière volonté ne fait pas avancer le pion Assimilation.

Name: Kings of War: The Battle for Ironhold – Two Player Battle Set
Description:
Since ancient times, the world has been ravaged by war. The wise foresee an age of horror approaching, for the spirit of the earth is sick, tainted by deadly sorcery in a great conflict ages past. Not that the warlords of this bloody era care, not while there is glory to be won, territory to be wrested from the enemy, foes to be slaughtered. The so-called Noble Peoples – Men, Elves and Dwarfs – now struggle for power and influence, battling across the ruins of long-dead realms, or staking claim to new lands. Their ancient pacts are no more. The kingdoms that pledged their armies in service of those sacred treaties are gone into legend, the descendants of the noble princes who swore eternal oaths of friendship warring openly with one another. The glorious empires of those days are lost to the ocean, or buried beneath shifting sands, the palaces of the wise now home to kraken or shambling revenants, while the scions of their great houses are exiled or long-dead...

This set contains a Kings of War 2nd Edition Gamer’s Rulebook, and 93 multi-part plastic Undead and Dwarf miniatures, including:

1 Skeleton Regiment
20 Skeleton Warriors
Hand Weapons and Shields or Spears and Shields
Command components including Standard Bearer and Musician.
Undead Dog
20 Zombies
10 Ghouls
20 Ironclad
10 Ironwatch
10 Shieldbreakers
1 Ironbelcher Cannon/Organ Gun with Crew
Square Bases

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.

Name: Das lustige 7-Hühnchen-Spiel
Description: The players start at the red space near space 1. The first to reach the red space at the henhouse wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner or die. On the numbered spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Summit 2030
Description:
Summit 2030 is a board game where players reflect, discuss and vote to bring the issues of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development to global attention.

The 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda, together with their 169 goals, address the issue of sustainability from different points of view taking into account, for example, education, health, gender equality, job opportunities, climate change, environmental protection.

By playing Summit 2030, participants will be able to identify with some of the stakeholders involved in the Agenda implementation process. The main purpose of the game is to bring the SDG of one’s chosen role (stakeholder) to the highest level of discussion, that is global attention.

Using cards you move your SDGs up on the scale. When an SDG reaches the top step, a vote begins. If all the players vote in favor, the round ends and the points are calculated. If even one player votes against, the SDG is placed on the lowest step and the round continues. Players have a limited number of votes against in each round.

The game ends after completing the third round, or at the end of any round chosen as the last one. The player with the highest score is the winner. In the event of a tie, the players share the win.

Summit 2030 is freely inspired by Stefano Luperto’s “King Up”.

—description from publisher

Name: Хайдути
Description:
During the Ottoman rule of the Bulgarian lands, the hajduks (Ð¥Ð°Ð¹Ð´ÑƒÑ‚Ð¸), thousands of unwavering men and women would embark on the terrible, but glorious path to freedom.
In the 1860s and 1870s, when the game is set, the Bulgarian revolutionary movement was at its peak.

There are three game modes - short, medium and long. Three important indicators of the game must be monitored - Recruitment, Activity and Combat Power. They are all tracked on the "committee board" in front of each player. The Winner of Ð¥Ð°Ð¹Ð´ÑƒÑ‚Ð¸ will be the one who gathers the most powerful detachment of freedom fighters, which depends on the strength of his committee. 
During a turn, players can choose different types of revolutionaries, form groups and encounter Ottoman guards, all done in a certain order. Also, they will be able to recruit real Bulgarian historical figures, like Vasil Levski, who have skills inspired by their life path.

Name: Cabbage!
Description:
Two farmers compete for the largest cabbage field. The player who after 6 turns has the largest number of connected cabbages in their color wins the game.

Cabbage! is a quick to play game that presents a particularly colorful and tasty challenge. Optimize the cabbage field with only 6 moves (either flip, rotate or replace), outwit your opponent and become the glorious king or queen of cabbage!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dinosaur Bingo
Description: A variant of bingo, each player has a board with a 4x4 grid of 16 dinosaurs.  The caller randomly picks one of 48 different dinosaur tiles for the players to match.  The first player to fill their card of 16 is the winner.

Name: Ascidiae
Description:
In Ascidiae you control a thriving colony of ascidians, tiny marine immobile animals, and race to establish new colonies on neighbouring rocks.

In this assembly-line puzzle, players use their ascidiae to spawn tadpoles, and their tadpoles to create new tadpoles and ascidiae through metamorphosis. Get the right group of tadpoles to establish a new colony, and claim to colonies to win the game!

Card ascidiae are placed on a grid in each player's board, 
 mostly immobile, and activate following the zig-zagging aquatic currents. Wooden tadpoles are placed on the cards and change and travel according to each ascidian habilities.

Each ascidia has its own different habilities, and can be initial (each player starts with two), common (all games have these) or special (six chosen from more than 25); with colonies that come in three difficulty levels and different player boards, game possibilities are endless.

Name: It's a Wonderful World: Leisure & Decadence
Description:
This second campaign expansion for It's A Wonderful World pushes your experience even further!

Each envelope introduces a new scenario, and each secret box adds new hidden content! All added components and cards can be used with the core game even after you  have completed the campaign.

This is not a legacy game, though there are surprises the first time it is played. The cards can be reset and the campaign played again in order to discover both possible endings.

Originally available only as part of the It's a Wonderful World: Corruption & Ascension Kickstarter campaign, this expansion is now available separately.

Contents:
166 Cards (100 x 65mm)
6 Scenario Envelopes
5 Secret Boxes, including 27 Secret Components
2 Heritage Boosters

Name: Staves
Description:
Staves is a game where 2 to 6 players play elemental staff sections to build magickal staves for the Mages' Guild.

Each player has hidden clients paying them extra to make sure the staves are to their specific liking. Players play elemental staff pieces from their hands to the common play area, one per turn, to help determine the elemental patterns for each staff, then draw a new Staves card once they have played. If a player can't play any card in their hand, they may draw one Staves card and play it if possible. New staves can be started by playing a "Foot" card, and staves are completed by playing a "Crown" card of the next element in the pattern. Once any six staves have been completed, the game ends and the clients are revealed for end-of-the-game scoring. The player who earns the most gold wins!

-description from publisher

Name: Эвакуация
Description:
Ð­Ð²Ð°ÐºÑƒÐ°Ñ†Ð¸Ñ, Evacuation 

A terrible explosion took place in the city. 
The metropolis turned into hell. 
Millions of people have gone missing... 
and only the most persistent will be able to get out of this hell... 
Can you become one of them ?

Gameplay: 
each player leads a group of 6 refugees, whom he must lead along a narrow and dangerous road among the ruins from the explosion to the rescue point: the bus. 
In order for a group of people to survive, to be able to leave for another country without loss, the player must, on its way out, collect a gas mask, a first aid kit and a backpack with food, but only those that are on special cards. 
Each player during the game will receive cards with tips on how to run to the bus.

Victory:
Everyone wants to survive, but there is only enough room on the bus for one group. 
As soon as someone's group is completely gathered near the bus, he/she wins, everyone else loses!

Name: Monopol: Malmö
Description:
The popular real estate game has arrived in Malmö, Sweden.

Walk around the town and find beautiful streets, interesting cultural institutions, companies and outdoor areas all for sale. 
Who doesn't want to own the magnificent Malmö Opera House, Turning Torso Skyscraper, Möllevångstorgið, Cosmopol Casino or Eyrarsundsbrún? 
The way to victory is to show foresight, invest well and make good deals. 
The one who accumulates the most wealth and acquires the whole town stands out as the winner.

Name: Indianapolis In-A-box
Description: Indianapolis In-A-Box is a board game based on the GREAT city of Indianapolis.  We chose some favorite landmarks (Circle Center Monument) and traditions (State Fair), mixed in a big race (Indy 500 race car), lots of basketball, traffic jams, keys to the city, BIG FUN! and voilà (vwa la) - behold; there it is Indianapolis In-A-Box.
Families: Series: ... in a Box (Late for the Sky)

Name: Orcs! Dicing with Death
Description:
Orcs! Dicing with Death is a push-your-luck gambling dice game designed by The Guild of Good Games primarily to be played in the live action roleplaying world of Empire by Profound Decisions. No knowledge of LARP or Empire is required to play or enjoy the game.

The game starts with a “Pit Fight” set-up phase during which players determine the order of play for the main “Battle” phase. The Battle consists of several rounds during which each player in turn rolls dice to try to defeat barbarian orcs and collect coins as booty, before either taking casualties or deciding to withdraw from battle in order to avoid casualties.  Whoever has collected the most coins when all the barbarian orcs are defeated wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Flower Pit
Description:
Flower Pit is a game for 2-4 players in which each player tries to earn the most points.

The game uses a stack of "seed" cards and "flower cards".  Each square card shows a 2x2 grid of colored fields, with some of the cards having holes cut into the fields.  Seed cards have the smallest size holes, and flower cards have larger holes is various shapes.

On their turn, a player chooses either a face up seed or flower card and places it on a communal field following various rules.  If the player places a seed card, they'll earn points based upon contiguous groupings of a single color; if they've placed a flower card, they'll earn points based upon the number of levels to the flower.

Play continues until all seed and flower cards have been placed.  Each player then reveals and scores a hidden "lucky" card, which will earn that player points for a certain color of field.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Give Me Money or I'll Kick Your Cat
Description:
Give Me Money is the ultimate game of threats and payoffs.

The adult party game with no judges - no votes, just horrible threats for cold, hard cash.

This game is for adults only and contains material offensive to most people. If you find nothing in this game that offends you, you should probably consider therapy (and if you are already in therapy, you may want to up your dosage.

—description from the box

Name: Ah é, né?
Description:
Ah é, né? is a card game for 3 to 5 players where the most important is to create the most creative history.

Each player has a hand of cards showing, each, a different object or person.
Each round one card is opened in the center of the table and, starting with these card, each player in sequence must continue a history adding one of the card he hold in his hand.
This way, each round the players have less cards to choose from and to attach to the history.
After every player use one card, everyone must vote who make the best piece of history in these round, but the player cannot vote in himself.
Each vote is one victory point.
After a certain amount of rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Log #32
Description:
“Don’t forget the popcorn.” – Doctor Joan Raddock, GIA analyst

Released in June 2006, this Captain’s Log issue supports Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Federation & Empire. “Circle of Vengeance” by Randy O. Green has Klingon, Hydran, and Vudar ships fighting a battle in an asteroid field. Will their fear, hate, and distrust find an end?  “The Last Command,” also by Green, follows a Carnivon in command of a Bear-Dog dreadnought.

In addition to the story, History includes information on nobility titles and an article on Tholian military ranks.

As is usual, Communications informs readers about the company’s activities. Captain’s Log #31 and SFB Module F2 have after-action reports. The company laid out its plans for new print releases and metal miniatures for the coming year, including the new Federation Commander. There are questions and answers about that new, faster-playing game. The Input Guide has guidelines for submissions to Federation Commander. Proposals for Star Fleet Battles are presented. Admiral Growler answers SFB questions. More “Why” questions get answered. There is a page of filk songs. Finally, there are the Star Fleet Awards.

Federation Commander has prototype rules from Romulan Border. The first tactics papers appear. Finally, there is an example of play for the game. Later in the issue, the scenario “Sabotage!” provides a battle opportunity between the Klingons and the Federation.

This issue includes five scenarios for Star Fleet Battles. 

     SL241, Circle of Vengeance, and SL242, Last Command, are based on the two stories in the issue.
     Set during the Early Years, SL236, Web of Curiosity, involves an encounter between the Tholians and Klingons. 


SL243, Network Disruption, is tied to the Battle Group scenario that features the fleet of one of the Galactic Powers facing the Andromedans. 
SL244, Hearth and Home, has the Hydrans facing a Coalition fleet of Klingons and Lyrans.  
Based in the Omega Octant, Dragonslayer SL245 has an Iridani clipper facing a Branthodon young dragonship.

Database articles include battlegroups designed with 800 points and the optional use of partial X-refits. There is an article on the cosmic cloud. Kosnett’s war is updated from its appearance in Advanced Missions. There is a guide for converting captured Klingon ships to fit into Lyran fleets and vice versa.

The Tactics section has “Victory at Origins 2005,” by Ken Lin. The primer focuses on the Drex, located in the Omega Octant. There are three pages of term papers, including some encore term papers.

The Venues section covers Star Fleet Command, SFB On-Line, playing by email, Galactic Conquest, Star Fleet Warlord, Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Battle Force.

Federation & Empire has a status update along with rules and rulings. There are four pages of tactical notes. Finally, there is the Q&A section.

New ships are added for Star Fleet Battles. The Klingons get “collared” ships:  DC7 collared battlecruiser and the DC5 collared war cruiser. The Vudar gain more ships with their command cruiser, advanced technology command cruiser, fast carrier resupply frigate, X-scout, and supply cruiser. The Vudar also get a medium bomber squadron, heavy bomber squadron, and bases for both types of bombers. The Federation receives its (old) light scout cruiser and its (old) heavy fighter carrier. The Klingons get a refitted captured Lyran war cruiser and Lyran destroyer. Conversely, the Lyrans get a refitted captured Klingon D5 war cruiser and Klingon F5 frigate. Federation Commander gets new ship cards for the Romulan King Eagle cruiser and K7R battlecruiser and the Gorn battle destroyer and battlecruiser. These four ships are in fleet scale.

Name: Crash Master
Description:
It's 1938 and your plane has crashed in the remote Alaskan wilderness on its way to Anchorage.

Using only the items from the plane, will you survive and find your way out of the wilderness?

This at-home escape room in a box takes between 90 minutes and 3 hours.

Solve your way out of the forest by finding hidden clues and solving intriguing puzzles.

The game works best for 1 to 8 players ages 12 and older.

—description from the publisher

Name: Campaigns of Ozz
Description:
Campaigns of Ozz recreates the battles and campaigns for the control of the post apocalyptic Land of Ozz. While Campaigns of Ozz is designed to be played as a stand alone board wargame, it is fully compatible with the Wars of Ozz miniatures game system by John “Buck” Surdu and the miniatures figure line as each counter represents a regiment of miniatures.
Players control the armies of the four main nationalities of Ozz including Munchkins, Quadlings, Winkies and Gillikins plus a wide variety of mercenary units.
This is not your parents land of Ozz but rather a much darker and more dangerous land where the threat of invasion and conquest is ever present. This is reflected in the wide range of historical battles and campaigns included which chart the blood soaked recent history of Ozz.

—description from the publisher

Name: Be Witching
Description:
Every thousand years, the stars align in a way that heralds the arrival of a new Witchqueen. Someone who can guide the magical community into the next age of sorcery, enchantment, and magical drama. How to decide who could possibly carry such a burden? The way witches have for millennia: throw a ridiculous party and show off your very best outfit.

3-6 players draw on provided body templates their outfits for a witch ball using themes on cards drawn from a deck. Then, during a five minute timer, all players debate and finally vote on the best fit between outfit and drawn cards. In the final round, two finalists answer interview questions, and the other player(s) award them points based on their answers. The player with the most points wins.

It's a role-playing game for kids, adults, or both at the same time that celebrates the magic of femme expression and the power in being your most authentic self.

Name: Globetrotter
Description:
Globetrotter - travel the world and the 7 seas.

Enjoy a fantastic travel around the world - and test your knowledge about all the countries on your trip!

Globetrotter is an entertaining family game, where the players participate in an exiting race across the continents answering educational questions about the world.

All players start in "Alaska" and follow the route across the continents. To continue on your turn, you must answer correctly to the question given from a country on the current continent the player is travelling through. A throw with the dice, determines both how far you can travel on your turn, as well as the difficulty of the question.

The "globetrotter" to reach "THE END" beneath New Zealand first, is the winner.

Name: 1 Stat Skirmish
Description:
1 stat skirmish is a tactical skirmish system with simple rules, where all stats of a miniature are boiled down to 1 single stat.
Included are rules for solitaire gaming, too!

The system is miniatures agnostic and due to its abstaction of everything suitable for all kinds of ranges and genres.
A fantasy brawl? Go for it. A western shootout? Will do. A cyberpunkt heist? Hell yeah! Cthulhu (god, I just copy and pasted this word just to get it right..) investigation? Anytime!

The rules actually fit on 1 page, the cheatsheet on another.

—description from the designer

Name: Petronella Apfelmus: Zauberspaß im Mühlengarten
Description:
The little witch Petronella Apfelmus and the twins Lea and Luis experience a new adventure in this game. This time Petronella accidentally turns caterpillar Amanda, the apple men, gnome Nisse and mouse Hilda into a colorful flower bed with weird magic spells. The players must help her out of this predicament!

The magic garden cards lie face down in the center of the table and resemble a vegetable patch. Who can best remember where the enchanted garden friends are hidden in this party game? Petronella must find the right way to turn them back.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Inqvisitor: The Ten Player Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds 12 more coins and innocence markers for a game with up to 10 players.

It also adds 10 character cards with different amounts of money and innocence. Some characters have special abilities.

This expansion was available with the Kickstarter in 2017.

Name: Inuk
Description:
88 Round Cards plus 10 Cut-Out Cards “Who am I?”

The INUK cards present a companion in play to the existential question, “Who am I, what makes me how I am?” Each 88 mm circular picture card depicts metaphorically a situation in which any of us might find ourselves. Players interpret the pictures through attributing feelings, moods and actions and so themselves become participants in the scenes. At the same time they might catch a glimpse of their own current inner state.
Artist Yilin Bai has enriched the OH-Card genre with her 88 paintings on the theme of self-discovery and self-determination. 10 cut-out cards operate as windows, keyholes or magnifying glasses to enhance and affect our perspectives.
For further surprises try combining the INUK images with the OH words!

Name: Armiño
Description:
Armiño (Ermine in Spanish language), was the fur clothes sported by Catholic Monarchs in Medieval Europe.

The cloth board and cards of this game emulate those luxury garments. Beside the board, the game consists in 44 field cards, 10 special cards, 2 player aid cards and the instructions. All components are made in Spain from small manufacturers. No plastic components.

The aim of designers was to take some mechanics of different games trying to make their own version of Gwent. Tough, the idea evolved and mixed some concepts from Age of Empires, Stratego, or even Carcasonne.

In Armiño the board and scenario is always changing, allowing a great replayability.

Plays can last from 1 to 30 minutes, depending on strategy and luck. At the beginning of the game, the red carpet will be displayed between contestants, each of them having a King card from the maze. Then, the rest of the 42 field cards (white back) must be mixed and both players shall receive 17 face down cards. Then, the special cards (black back) will be mixed too and just one will be given to each player.

The player will choose how to place cards on the cloth board. Decisions on how to place them will be based just in strategy.

Each card has an effect written on it, so each turn a player must do an action with the cards. Move them or use them according to its effects.

The special cards (epic, meteorite, transmute or breeze among them) can be used all along the game as many times as needed.

Easy to learn but hard to master, Armiño is a strategic card game of medieval combat for two players, whose goal is to kill the opponent's king. Fast and destructive, in the eventuality you could not achieve the regicide, the winner will be the player obtaining most victory points.

Name: Wargame for Kids
Description:
A free print & play wargame suitable for kids age 7+. Your goal is to destroy the enemy army.
The game starts with both players roll one 6 sided die with higher die-roll moving first. The winner moves one unit of his choice. If the winner’s die roll result is twice than opponent’s roll the player can move 2 units instead of one or move one unit and fire one shot with the Catapult.
At the end of movement the player resolves combat between adjacent units. 
After combat resolution the players re-roll again for who goes first.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Sovereign Slayer Solitaire
Description:
Sovereign Slayer Solitaire is a one player one page card game, based on the Carta SRD.

You will need a standard 54 cards deck, a 20-sided die, a red pawn and a black pawn to play.

Move your pawn around a random, initially face-down, 5 by 6 grid.  Build up your Luck and Equipment to help you battle the cards defending the Kings.  Roll equal to or higher than their value, or lose Health.

Kill all four Kings before your Health reaches zero to win.

Name: It's In The Vents!
Description:
"A distress signal. A foreign planet. An unexpected attack.
Your captain’s suit was breached.
You tried to impose a quarantine, but the team wouldn’t listen.
Now they’re all dead.
You’re not sure what they brought onto the ship, but whatever it is . . .
It’s In The Vents!"

To play, you’ll need:
1 standard deck of 54 cards, red & black jokers included
1 token, coin, or other character marker
1 counter or scrap of paper
A flat surface for laying out your card grid

On a 4 by 6 grid, search the ship for the cat and fuel for your plasma torch, as the thing in the vents comes ever closer.  If you can make it back to the escape pod with the cat before the thing in the vents reaches you, you win!

Name: The Last Shall Be First
Description:
A fun "take that" game of Catholic items and actions from the designer of "The Catholic Card Game" and the artist behind Tomics Comics.

Players take turns playing item cards in front of them or playing actions that affect other players' cards. The goal is to force other players to discard their cards and be the last player with cards in their possession.

Name: Headless Guide
Description:
"It is said in Nova Scotia that, when pirates decided to bury treasure, they came ashore with only a handful of men. The Captain, of course, and two or three men he trusted.

And one stranger.

It is said that, once the treasure was safely buried, the Captain would ask who wanted to stay behind and guard it. In the stories, the stranger volunteers, hoping to take the treasure and run.

So, the stranger is beheaded on the spot, their ghost left to haunt the place and guard the treasure for centuries. According to the stories, the stranger is bound to the place now, unable to leave, rest, or move on.

Unless, of course, someone were to discover the gold they have been guarding. Unless they could find some way to convince someone, anyone, to face their fears, head out into the night, and claim the blood gold for themselves."

Headless Guide is a game for a single person. It can be a simple solitaire card game or, if you prefer, a map-making game.

Gather two six-sided dice, something to write on, and something to write with. If you want, get a blank piece of paper to draw the map on.

A player lays out 11 cards with the Ace of Diamonds (representing the Treasure) on the end.

After choosing one of four characters, each with a different combination of Courage and Silence and a special ability, the player flips a card and reads the description tied to that card.

After resolving the rules on a card - often including an attempt to roll under their current Courage or Silence - and adjusting their values accordingly, the player flips again until their Courage runs out, or they claim the Treasure.

Name: Into The Glacier
Description:
"You have come to the Glacier because you have heard a story. You have every reason to believe it is true, and you have come to the Glacier to find something. Which story are you following, exactly?"

You Will Need:

One standard deck of playing cards
Two six-sided dice
A character marker like a figurine or small toy
A piece of paper and a pencil

A player will explore a grid of from 9 to 21 cards (depending on how long a game is desired) searching for the truth behind one of four stories.

Start with 8 Warmth. Every round, before moving, lose 1 Warmth.  Every round, choose a card next to your 
marker, turn it face-up if it is face-down. Look up that 
card and follow the instructions on it. (You might want to 
write in your journal about what you find there.)
 If you ever reach 0 Warmth, then you lose consciousness and need to be rescued. Move your character marker directly to the King of Hearts.

Your goal is to find the thing you came to the Glacier for, and then return to the Ace of Clubs. Your goal is also to see what you can see, find what you can find, and explore this untouched and mysterious place.

Name: Apex Predator
Description:
Apex Predator is a single-player game in which you explore an ancient forest, tracking down and fighting titanic monsters. Along the way, you'll face peril and find that the natural world may just be on your side.

You will need:

1 standard 52-card deck of playing cards
A 10-sided die
A pen or pencil
Paper or a journal
A marker, like a coin or small toy

Choose your quarry, and the size of your map (4x4, 4x5, or 5x5) then explore the Forest.  Cards may provide tools to help you defeat the Monster, or tracks to help you find its lair. Once you find the Monster in its lair, your Advantage provided by the tools you have discovered give you a bonus to the die roll as you fight.

Name: Foco Total
Description:
Pay attention to every new challenge. Combine your memory and attention to became the fastest player.

In this game of pattern recognition and speed, the players can choose 5 different difficulty levels, but the game play is the same for all levels.

There are several cards showing forms with different Colors and patterns that are opened in the center of the table.

Each round the dice for the chosen difficulty are rolled and the combination of the dice show to players one and only one combination between the cards on the center of the table. The objective is to be the fastest player to recognize the correct card.

Name: Sílabas de Ouro
Description:
The path is full of danger, but in order to reach the treasure room you must fond words with the same syllable in different positions.

This is another educational game from Idea Jogos, aimed for young children in the alphabetisation age.

On your turn you must roll a dice to move inside a dungeon map, full of fields with traps. If you land on a trap, several things can happen (like not being able to play your next turn).

On the other hand, if you land on treasure places, you can gather cards containing syllable, that you need on order to form words and as a requisite to be able to reach the treasure room and win the game.

It's a very interesting way to make little children starting to read.

Name: Tropic Race
Description:
Get your monkey racers to safety from the erupting volcano, by crossing the dangerous river, and avoiding the hungry lion.

By rolling a 10-sided die, players get to move their own team of 4-6 monkeys towards the safe space, or move the lion on it's search for a monkey snack, or move the turtles, ferrying monkeys along the river. The game is won by the first player to get their whole team of monkeys to safety.

Tropic Race is the childrens version of the family game Arctic Race by danspil released in 2020.

Tropic Race is a new take on traditional roll and move games like Pachisi, with a lot of player interaction, and the choice to take different paths along the race, some more risky than others.

-description from designer

Name: Play the Ancient Greek Wars
Description:
From the Trojan War, to the Persian conflicts up to the Macedonian conquest, through great battles from Marathon to Issus.

Cradle of Western civilization, the foundations of modern thought were laid in ancient Greece, but also bloody battles and total wars.

It is the epic story of the hoplite, armed with a shield, helmet, and breastplates. And also of the Macedonian phalanx. By reviewing the most significant armies and clashes, on land and at sea, of a failed empire.

—description from the publisher
Families: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
Series: Paper Battles and Dioramas (Soldiershop Publishing)

Name: Food Coma
Description:
Food Coma is a strategic elimination card game. Choose a playable chef and feed other players high calorie meals until they pass out - in a Food Coma. The last chef standing wins!

Players take turns drawing ingredient cards from the three stores to stack their hands. Ingredients are combined to make meals, which players feed to other players to increase their calorie counts. Once a player's calorie count is maxed out, they flip their game card over for one final chance. Eat one more meal and they're out of the game.

Each chef has their own unique power ability and there are special cards in each deck, making each draw a tactical decision! A rubber band mechanic sees players getting more powerful and becoming bigger threats the closer they get to being eliminated.

Food Coma is designed to be both a fast, fun party game that can be played in easy quick sessions and also a strategic game for more competitive players.

All of Food Coma's over 100 images are hand drawn and the dozens of unique ingredient cards each have a clever name and witty tagline.

Food Coma places strong emphasis on both visual appeal and gameplay integrity. This careful attention to detail ensures that the cards are not only enjoyable to play but also a delight to explore visually, contributing significantly to the overall charm and balance of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: The Long Con
Description:
The Long Con is the deck building game of conventioneering, where players are competing to be the first to build the best convention.  The inspiration for the game comes from the comic "Warning Label", by Thom Zahler.  In the series, the protagonist Danielle pitches a card game where players create their own comic convention and play against other convention promoters.

In The Long Con, players use pairs of guest and event cards to earn money or build their audience.  Money lets players add additional cards to their decks, while a bigger audience will upgrade their venue and ultimately win them the game.  The guests and events players can add to their decks give them more powerful combinations and unique bonuses.  In the end, the combinations of cards each player plays tell a fun, colorful story of how their convention grew into the ultimate con.

—description from the designer

Name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories
Description:
In Tiny Epic Dungeons: Stories players dive deeper into the lore of Aughmoore.

The Stories expansion introduces a new Story Mode that has Heroes completing Side Quests and adventuring deeper into the dungeon, descending Multiple Floors and eventually fighting multiple Dungeons Bosses at once!

In addition, Stories offers a slew of new Heroes, Loot, Dungeon Rooms, Dungeon Bosses, Minions, and Goblins!

The Stories expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Dungeons. It will share the same length and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!

Included in the Stories expansion:
- 8 Hero Minis and Mats (Zui Xiong, Evelynn, Aetoris, Nili Songheart, Zezili, Clotho, Lara Gambit, Sir Gamelyn)

- 8 Story Cards (Scry Into The Future, Purify The Water, Curse of the Hobgoblin, Vault Heist, Sacrifice A Minion, Rescue The Adventurers, A Dimensional Debt, The Golden Phoenix)

- 5 Dungeon Cards

- 12 Loot Cards (Eyes of the Viper, Shadow Gi of the Viper, Smoke Bombs of the Viper, Fangs of the Viper, Orbs of the Scarab, Vestment of the Scarab, Ward of the Scarab, Mage Blade of the Scarab, Dungeon Map, Bedrolls, Everlit Torch, Ceremonial Spear)

- 2 Boss Mats (The Tinkerer, The Mind Lasher)

- 2 Minion Cards (Fire Elemental, Golem)

- 2 Goblin Cards (Mighty Goblin, Spelly Goblin)

- 2 Minion Tokens

- 1 Boss Token

- 2 Objective Tokens

Name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Deluxe Edition
Description:
Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully co-operative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore.

In Tiny Epic Dungeons, players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss. Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path. Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.

Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.

The game is played over two acts: The Dungeon, and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts, the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.

After clearing the dungeon of all its minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.

These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!

Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss! In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect legendary loot, and supreme spells

Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect.

Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact?

The story is yours to tell in Tiny Epic Dungeons!

The Deluxe Edition includes the Potions and Perils mini expansion and all Deluxe Edition Stretch Goals and Kickstarter Exclusive Content.

The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins!

Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins.  When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!

Additionally,  the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!

Name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Crimson Silver mini expansion
Description:
The TEP Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!

Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!

Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.

The Crimson Silver mini expansion adds:


     2 Floating Fortress Tokens
     2 Solo Pirate Mats
     9 Shiny Cubes
     6 Deluxe Crew Cards


—description from the publisher

Name: Name Place Animal Thing
Description:
Name Place Animal Thing is a family deduction card game for 2-6 players. This game can be played by ages 9 and up.

This game exercises your brain as it involves all players to be attentive, continuously making them think, deduce and be alert al all times. It's an easy game to setup which only takes a couple of minutes. Players would need to eventually guess the four cards which are hidden from them at the beginning of the game. A dice makes the game more exciting as it allows players to perform certain actions depending on what is rolled. In this game it is easy to fool any opponent by asking for cards they already have and making it tough for everyone else to follow. 
It is a great game for family bonding!

Best played with 4 players!

Name: Les Coureurs du Vel d'Hiv
Description: The game is a cycling race for four people. Each player receives a cyclist of his color. They are placed on the starting field of the game board and have to drive one and a half laps. The cyclists are moved forward using cubes. Events such as "Accident" or "Disqualification" occur on some fields of the game board.

Name: Marlowe to Maidenhythe: A Fictional Campaign and Scenario Pack For TsS ! King and Parliament
Description:
Marlowe to Maidenhythe is designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules but useful with other rule systems too.

The PDF contains twelve free-standing fictional scenarios set in the counties of Buckinghamshire and Berkshire during the English Civil War. 
They tell the story of a series of clashes between Sir John Boulters (for the King) and Sir Christopher Grey (for Parliament). 
Each scenario contains a background briefing, separate briefings for each of the players, a deployment plan and orders of battle. 
The scenarios can be played individually or in sequence, as a campaign. 
Many of the characters and units recur throughout the campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jogo do burro
Description:
ENG: 
The amount of cards is determined according to the number of players, wiht one person getting an extra, "donkey" card.

The cards are shuffled and distributed. The person who has an extra card starts the game by moving a card from his hand to the left, happening like this until someone forms a quartet and silently lowers the cards on the table, so that the others don't see. The last one to lay a card on the table is the "donkey" of the round.

Each time a player loses, a letter of the word "donkey" is marked. The player who completes the word first, is the "donkey" and will lose of the game. The number of cards that player still has is counted and another card is drawn (called the year of forgiveness). The total number of cards is the losing player's "dumb" years.

The winner is the last one who has not completed the word "donkey" while the others have.

---
PT-BR:
A quantidade de cartas é determinada conforme a quantidade de jogadores, sendo quatro cartas com a mesma numeração para cada pessoa que jogar  mais uma carta de "burro"

O objetivo do jogo é formar quartetos e não ser o último jogador a baixar as cartas na mesa.

As cartas são embaralhadas e distribuídas, a pessoa que tiver uma carta a mais começa o jogo passando uma carta da sua mão para a esquerda, acontecendo assim até que alguém forme um quarteto e baixe as cartas na mesa de forma silenciosa, para que os outros distraídos  não vejam, o último a baixar é o "burro" da rodada

Cada vez que um jogador perde, é assinalada uma letra da palavra "burro". O jogador que completar primeiro a palavra, é o "burro" e será o perdedor do jogo, conta-se o número de cartas que esse jogador ainda tem, e é costume tirar-se uma carta chamada ano de perdão e o resultado são os anos de "burro" do jogador perdedor.

O vencedor é o último que não tenha completado a palavra "burro" enquanto os outros tenham.

Name: Roll it up: roll your joints!
Description:
Roll it Up is set in the cannabis world: in fact, the goal is basically to roll your joints before the other players.
it is a card-game: every player will have a number of green flower cards in front of himself, and three tool-adversity card in hand.
after drawing the first card, placing it in front of himself (near the green card) or in the discard deck (face-up, near the main deck) the player will draw a card from the main deck, giving the turn to the player next to him.

The goal shall be agreed among the players before starting the game and, when achieved, can be set again to let the game continue.

—user summary

Name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – The Starblood Stalkers
Description:
The latest addition to the Direchasm repertoire of teams available to conduct tactical combat for game and glory. Compatible for use with all the previous Warhammer Underworlds games.

Contents:
6 Push-fit Starblood Stalkers Miniatures
6 Fighter Cards
12Starblood Stalkers Objective Cards
10 Starblood Stalkers Upgrade Cards
10 Starblood Stalkers Ploy Cards
10 Universal Objective Cards
10 Universal Upgrade Cards
8 Universal Gambit Cards
2 Universal Gambit Spell Cards

Name: Worm & Cozy
Description:
Worm & Cozy is a medium-weight strategic spatial roll-and-write game offering meatier puzzles than most roll-and-writes, but sharing their simple materials, solo playability, and streamlined rules.

Use the roll of the dice cleverly to fit worms onto your board, give them body parts, and have those body parts act. You can use any one of thirteen different game sheets for each game; each tells a different chapter from the history of the worms, and has a few unique ways to score. There’s one way to lose points on any sheet: leaving worms touching blank space. So fit your worms together cozily!

At first you need only read 3 pages of rules, and then play Chapter 1, in which the eye is the only organ that has an action: to find food.

Play at your own pace through the chapters. Each of the first 6 chapters introduces the power of one more of the six organ types: With a mouth, a worm can eat food to grow more organs. With a brain it can get some control of the colony’s fate by changing die rolls. With a heart, a worm can grow longer. With a pointy tail it can team up into a “Conga Line”. And with “collars”, two worms – who love each other very much! – can make short baby worms.

—description from the designer

The game's playtesting and development is documented in: 
[WIP] Worm & Cozy - 4th Roll & Write Game Design Contest - Contest Ready.

Name: Don't Squeak With Your Mouth Full!!
Description:
ã¿ã‚“ãªã§ã„ãŸã ããƒžã‚¦ã‚¹ (Min'na de itadakimausu) Don't Squeak With Your Mouth Full!! is a card game from Japan.

You’re a peckish family of mice, fighting over the plates of food in front of you! You’ll have to chews your food wisely, because if you take too much you’ll be forced to share. Will you be crafty enough to get the most food?
publisher's summary

The deck has 5 kinds of food, numbered 1, 2 or 3. Players are dealt three hand cards, and cards are turned up in a line, one more than the number of players.

Players simultaneously point at one card in the line they want to take. If they are the only player at a card, they take the food to their tableau. If two or more players point to one card, nobody gets it (unless the start player in the round is involved, they get it). More cards are dealt to the line, stacking up with cards not previously taken.

Once players have built up their tableau, they may have to shed cards to their neighbours if they have too much of one food.

At the end of the game, the mouse with the most points is the winner.
user summary

Name: Les guerres du Roi Soleil: la Fronde 1648-1653
Description:
Bonus scenario N ° 6 (French magazine VaeVictis #156 (May-June 2021)
This scenario is a bonus. It does not correspond exactly to the wars of Louis XIV, but concerns the future monarch because this event forged his character and participated in his absolutism. Casus belli: taking advantage of the weakness of royal power while Louis, the future Louis XIV, was still a minor, the parliament of Paris and the nobility (called the Princes) revolted at different periods and to different degrees against the regency ensured by Anne of Austria (widow of Louis XIII) and Cardinal Mazarin, hated by all. This weakening of France is a boon for Spain, still at war with France, to recover territories (Catalonia, Roussillon, the North of France).

The kingdom of France represents the party of the Regent Anne of Austria, Cardinal Mazarin and the king's faithful (some military leaders move from one camp to another) and their allies (Duchy of Savoy, some German states, etc. .).
Spain represents the party that brings together the princes as well as the various allies (other German states, Duchy of Lorraine, etc.); for simplicity this party is called the Coalition.

—description from the designer

Name: Gorinto: 5th player expansion
Description:
This expansion includes everything you need to add a fifth player to your games of Gorinto.
It therefore contains 25 element tiles (5 of each element), a player board, a Wisdom marker and a Great Wisdom marker.

Name: Checker Football
Description: Board resembles a 20x13 square grid football field with endzones. Each player has 11 helmet-shaped playing pieces consisting of 7 linemen, 2 halfbacks, 1 fullback, and 1 quarterback.

Name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Norway
Description:
Norway was the first battlefield where British, French and German soldiers would battle on land in World War II. It would last longer than the Battle of France. It was the first modern combined arms operation with navy, air and land forces. One which the Wehrmacht performed to their German perfection.
It was a gross violation of neutral states and Operation Weserübung would conclude in the occupation of Norway and Denmark for the reminder of the war in Europe.

Firestorm: Norway  uses  three  maps  to  plot  the  strategic  situation and show the effects of your table top games on the battles for Norway. All of the important units, territory, and objectives of the operation are represented on the map. Your units  will  clash  at  important  locations  with  the  best  forces  from  both  sides,  such  as  the  Gebirgsjäger,  Fallschirmjäger,  Alpine  Troops  and  Legionaries  as  well  as  the  Norwegian  army.

Victory  conditions:  It  will  be  very  hard  for  the  Allies  to  achieve any kind of a real victory in Firestorm Norway and the  victory  conditions  reflect  this.  Events  in  France  will  overtake  the  Campaign  in  Norway  and  affect  the  support  of the British and French so the Allies will score points for holding out and slowing the German advance.

All the rules you will need are included to play.
Downloadable tokens are  provided  although  you  can  easily  substitute  them  with  other models.

Name: Totemic: Feather and Fang
Description:
This expansion consists of all stretch goals unlocked throughout the Totemic KS campaign.

Totemic: Feather and Fang contains 7 additional spirits and 14 specific aspects.

Name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Lorraine
Description:
Battles in Lorraine saw some of the heaviest tank engagements on the Western Front in World War Two, of which the Tank battles of Arracourt are the most famous. 
The Lorraine Campaign saw two poorly supported armies face each other. 
The US Third Army was at the end of a successful campaign to liberate France but was now reduced to a secondary role while the Allies prepared for Operation Market Garden.

Players  use  their normal Flames Of War forces to fight battles to capture areas, reinforced by the main combat units shown on the campaign map.  
Each  game  the  player  makes a new force to respond to the  situation they face.

All of the rules needed to play are included.

Name: No Fish!: A Game of Environmental Catastrophe for the Whole Family
Description:
No Fish! is a darkly humorous, weirdly educational twist on the classic card game Go Fish!

It's good, clean, apocalyptic fun for adults and a great way to teach kids age-five-and-up about where our environment is at now and where the logic of zero-sum consumerism will take us.

No Fish! is like Go Fish! played backwards. Instead of collecting sea creatures, they all go into an extinction pile.

The goal of the game is to make your opponents’ creatures go extinct while sticking them with all the ocean plastic.  The last player holding a living organism “wins.”

—description from the designer

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Collector's Edition (Gamefound Edition)
Description:
The Collector's Edition of Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island that was launched on Gamefound contains exclusive content (including ones impact game play) that will not be found in the retail version of the Collector's edition.

Both the Gamefound and retail version of the Collector's Edition includes:
- Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island (basegame)
- 18 stunning 35mm figures
- Open & Play Tutorial Campaign
- Access to Companion app

This Gamefound edition will also include multiple exclusive Gamefound Stretch Goals including:

- Modular Camp Model (8 pieces)
- Horse companion miniature
- Parrot companion miniature
- Cat companion miniature
- 10 Supporting Item miniatures

- 30 new adventure cards
- 10 event cards
- 3 Weather Tiles
- Dramatic Morale Mini-expansion
- Cave Mini-expansion (Cave tile + 5 tokens)

- First player Marker & Round Tracker
- Dice Tower
- Triple-Layered Player Boards
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Hot Rod Grand Prix
Description: Gotta Go Fast!  Race to the finish with up to four players.  Roll the dice and move along the track but watch out for the hazards.  If you land on a hazard you must abide by its instructions whether they're favorable or not.  The first player to reach the final square wins!

Name: Counter-Attacks! 1
Description:
Counter—Attacks! — The SS Legions 1
brings 8 mid-war, Waffen SS battles scenarios.
Pitched firefights from the Upper Aisne River in 1940 to Krasny Bor in 1943.

Other than the usual ASL-RB and counters, the CH geo-boards: CH1, CH2, W1, W2, W3, and W4 are needed.

Counter—Attacks! 1 contains 8 scenarios, as well as 2 sheets of color die-cut counters, including new soldier art for 1940 Waffen SS MMC/SMC, British and Italian SW in Russian brown, T-28 m34 and T-26 m37 tanks in Winter whitewash and more.

Scenarios:

     A Deadlier Beat - Voncq, France, June 9th 1940
     Jungle Fortress of Salla - Salla, Finland, July 1st 1941
     Blood Red Snow - Gorodische, Russia, November 17th 1941
     Saving the Devils - Dubrovnik, Croatia, October 19th 1943
     Shuttlecocks of Fate, Dubrovnik, Croatia, 8-September 8th 1943
     Defiance Before Infamy - Wormhoudt, France, May 28 1940
     Vikings on the Steppes - Ingushetian Province, Russia, October 3rd 1943
     Taiga Tigers - Krasny Bor, Russia, March 23rd 1943

Name: Horns Up!
Description:
The Lacuna Coil Official Card Game

Welcome to the most action-packed party card game ever: Horns Up! Inspired by the amazing atmospheres, the most exciting and overwhelming concerts of all, like the Lacuna Coil live events.

The goal is to be the first to move from an entrance to the front of the stage. Players take turns playing Path cards to move toward the stage, or wall/ticket cards to block their opponents. Once you move, any path cards with no pawns on them flip as the crowd moves in, forcing other players to play new path cards. The first one to reach center stage wins!

Name: Everdell: Spirecrest – Trailblazers Pack
Description:
Upgrades the Standard Edition of Everdell: Spirecrest with the Collector's Edition content.

This item includes:
 9 Discovery Cards,
 3 Big Critter meeples (peacock, boar, vulture),
 4 plastic saddles, 
6 Owl meeples with Frog Ambassador and Rabbit Traveler,
 6 Mole meeples with Frog Ambassador and Rabbit Traveler,
 6 Lizard meeples with Frog Ambassador and Rabbit Traveler,
 1 Rulesheet

Name: Black Progress Game
Description:
Play as an African-American Scientist, Artist, Entertainer, or Explorer as you work your way to the Hall of Fame

Players roll dice and move from their starting corner to the Hall of Fame in the center of the board. Each square has instructions for players to draw cards from the Progress, Heritage, and Hall of Fame draw piles, win or lose points from/to other players, draft cards from or give cards to other players, purchase cards, and move to other areas of the board. The goal is to be the first player to the Hall of Fame.

Family game. Luck driven with mechanics similar to the Game of Life.

Name: 18EE/82 Eastern Europe
Description:
Like 18WE/72, 18EE/82 is an operational strategy game based on Mike Hutton’s popular 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties system covering Easter Europe.  It features a larger board, 21 major companies, and more offboard areas than either 18EA/62 or 18WE/72.  Any player familiar with 18WE/72 will very easily be able to enjoy 18EE/82, because the rules are almost completely identical aside from setup.

18EE/82 features five regions instead of three, in which only three of four corporations are typically startable, as well as 3 minor companies in Hungary.  The four non-Hungarian regions feature randomly selected subsidies at setup, out of a pool of five.  These simple differences in setup present the players with major strategic decisions in what railroads to found, as well as how their companies will best be developed and operated.

18EE/82 has extremely high replayability, due to its random setup at the beginning of the game.  Every non shell company is assigned a license type randomly (from expresses, freights, and regionals).

18EE/82 has a larger board than 18WE/72, covering much of Eastern Europe.  The map also has more offboard areas, including the premier zones of Berlin and Constantinople.  Like in 18WE/72, there is no plain yellow track.  All track tiles are unlimited. Each company gets at least three track actions to determine tile placements and upgrades.  The map size supports more stations which can be acquired during the life of each corporation.  Each corporation may lay TWO additional tokens each operating round, instead of just one.

The financial aspects of 18EA/62 you will find almost fully intact. There are parliament rounds, mergers, and refinancing, all as players know them from its predecessor game. Similarly both chartered and non-chartered corporations function in exactly the same ways.  This allows players to focus on the operational aspects of the game, without having to learn a new financial framework if they are familiar with either game.

—description from the designer

Name: Moon Mullins Automobile Race
Description:
A race game for 2-4 players

Players spin to pick first player - highest number wins. each player spins and moves forward. Red and Green dots on the board turn the cars in other directions. Avoid the buses if you can.   Players must visit all four corners of the board to win the game.

Board and rules are glued inside of box bottom.
Components:
Spinner (1)
Player tokens (4)

Spinner can be replaced with a 4-sided die.

Name: Game of Robinson Crusoe
Description:
Simple race game with a twist.  The winner is the last (slowest) player to make it to the beach and so becomes Robinson Crusoe. Red dots move players forward; black dots move players backward.

Components
Spinner (1)
Player tokens / pebbles (4)

Board and rules glued to bottom box. Spinner can be replaced by 4 sided die

Minimal artwork and cover design point to early publication date.

Name: Cónclave: Expansión Primigenia
Description:
A cosmic break has corrupted the magic world of Conclave.

Now the control of the Magics of the realm is bonded with deadly Primordial Gods. 
The control of a Magic will invoke a Primordial deity, and they will demand a ritual.

In the Primordial Expansion`, players will have to meet some conditions if they invoke a Primordial God, if the conditions are not achieved, the Primordial God will devour the player.

Name: Sto Auto Race
Description:
A tin race circuit for 1-2 players.  The winner is the first to travel 100 miles to the finish.

Players have a car and matching color marble.  Players attempt to shoot the marble into indents "holes" marked 5 miles or 10 miles in order to advance their car. Additional holes create delays for drivers.

Components:
2 die cast cars - red and blue
2 marbles - red and blue

Name: Leap for Life
Description:
Players complete to make the most points for 4 successful skydives.

Points are awarded based on landing in a safe area of the board. First player and movement are based on a spinner (which can be replaced by a 4-sided die)

Board and rules are glued to bottom of box.

Name: Don't Wake the Dragon
Description:
Don't Wake the Dragon is a two-player microgame in which you take turns attempting to mine for gold in a dragon's lair without waking them up.

Each turn, you roll a d6 to determine how heavy a sleeper the dragon is; if it's a high number, it's a heavy sleeper; if it's a low number, not so much.

After the d6 is rolled, players take turns placing down a card numbered from 1-6, representing how much of a disturbance you created when mining. These cards add up to a total value between the two players, and if a player plays a card that takes the total value above the value of the d6, they must pick up cards equal to the difference between the collective card the d6 value.

The first player to have no cards in their hand is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: A Viking's Tale
Description:
A Vikings Tale. The competitive card game for 2-4 players.

Players choose a Clan and battle against creatures and other Players. Use Different Equipment Cards and Fate Cards to win the most battles in the game

If you get the most Honor Points at the End of the game you win.

Name: Half-Pint Heroes: Trinkspiel
Description: Mini extension: It contains 7 playing cards printed on both sides and a cover card with information on where the English rule can be downloaded. The German rule is included.

Name: Pilo
Description:
IntroductionPilo is a finite territory game for two players: Blue and Orange. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The recommended board sizes are between 6x6 and 10x10 squares.

Both players must have access to a sufficient number of disks of their own color and a sufficient number of neutral blocks.

				
				
					DefinitionsA stack is a disk lying directly on the board along with all other disks piled onto it on the same square.

The height of a stack is the number of disks in it.

A group is a stack along with all other like-colored stacks one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent stacks of its color.

Similarly, a patch is a square not occupied by a block along with all other such squares one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent squares not occupied by blocks. Note a patch may contain any number of groups, as well as empty squares.

The size of a group or patch is the number of squares it spans.

				
				
					PlayBlue plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if possible, make exactly one of these board plays:

- Place a disk of your color on an empty square.

- Move a stack of your color any number of squares in a straight orthogonal line, without jumping over any blocks or enemy stacks, to a square occupied by an enemy stack of the same height. Then, remove this enemy stack, add a disk to your stack on that square and place a block on the square from which you just moved your stack. Note a stack can jump over friendly stacks.

If you have no board plays available on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. Then, for each patch on the board, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from it until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over in a patch owns the patch. Empty patches are owned by neither player.

The player with the higher score in the resulting position wins. Your score is the sum of the sizes of the patches that you own. If there is a tie, whoever made the last board play loses.

				
				
					Pie ruleThe pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means Orange will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

Name: Quaxtep
Description:
IntroductionQuaxtep is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. The board squares alternate between a light and a dark color in a checkered fashion. On odd-sized boards, the center square must be light-colored.

				
				
					PlayBlack starts the game by performing one action. From then on, the players alternate performing two actions per turn. The available actions are:


     Placing a friendly stone on an empty light square.



     Moving a friendly stone from a light square to an adjacent empty dark square.


You can only pass your turn, or the second action of a turn, if you have no legal actions available. There will always be a legal action available to at least one of the players.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of stones of their color touching the two opposite board edges of their color. A chain is a set of mutually connected stones. Two like-colored stones are connected if they occupy orthogonally adjacent squares or diagonally adjacent dark squares.

—description from the designer

Name: Mythos Encounters: A Cooperative Horror Miniature Skirmish Game
Description:
Cooperative Miniature Encounters in the Cthulhu Mythos.

Mythos Encounters is a miniature skirmish game of the Cthulhu Mythos. This is a cooperative game, in which Investigators work together to face the horrors of ruthless cultists, mysterious alien creatures and the elder gods themselves.

Your investigators can face enemies head-on, trusting in your strength and weaponry, or take a more subtle approach using stealth and gathering clues to gain an advantage.

Enemy creatures in Mythos Encounters change from encounter to encounter, and their behavior is determined by a variety of AI tactics.

As your investigators progress through each encounter, they will gain new abilities, equipment and allies that will allow them to face even greater threats. They may also gain permanent physical injuries or debilitating mental disorders.

Mythos Encounters is played as a series of linked encounters using your own terrain and miniature figures. This game has no official terrain or miniatures.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bimba: What Do You See
Description:
Rediscover the power of your imagination as you take on the role  of a storyteller. Use the Bimba Cards to interpret phrases in your own unique way. Then convince your fellow players that your interpretation is the most meaningful. Score points for every vote you get and every vote you can sway in your favour. You win if you have the highest number of points at the end of the game.

Game Play..

Each player is dealt with 5 cards and as game begins, One player picks a phrase card and reads it out to the other players,

Each other player selects the card in their hands that best matches the phrase and gives the selected card to the dealer, without showing it to the others.

The dealer shuffles the cards with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player votes for the cards that best suits the phrase. They cannot vote for their own card. Then one of the player challenges the votes and tries to convince the others about why another card is better suited and pitch for it. Players can tell stories, bring out instances to convince the other players to change their votes. The challenger scores one pink token for every vote they turn in their favour.

Players score points for every vote for their own card and collects the tokens.

Apart from the phrase cards, players can opt to create their own Stories, Verse, Phrase or a word. If they win this round, they get an additional 20 points apart from the votes. 
The game ends when the deck is empty or when the players decide to end the game.

The base game and all expansions have 84 main Bimba cards each with phrase cards, Vote cards, 1 play mat, 84 winning tokens and 1 Rule book.

Name: The Fort
Description: The objective of The Fort is to knock down men consisting of a King, a Queen, their Bishops, and Guards. Players use a cue to push balls into a U-shaped fort with the men placed in predefined positions.

Name: Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind – Worldbuilders Exclusive: Secret Friend & Hero of Destiny (alt card)
Description:
Alternate artwork for previously released Hero of Destiny card featuring Kvothe.

All new promo card Secret Friend featuring Auri.

Worldbuilders-exclusive, originally available in return for donation through the 2019 Worldbuilders fundraiser.

Cards bundled together, not available separately.

Name: Attacktica
Description:
Attacktica is a two player abstract strategy game with dice to show you how to move.
Each player has 4 ships with 20 life points with maximum 6 life points per ship.
There are 2 sea monsters which are used from both sides.


     Life points are divided up to each ship, the life points are not visible from the opponent.
     Two dice per player, dice one; is for which ship or sea monster is to move and dice two; is for the amount of moves or life points to be taken, depending if it is stage one or stage two of the game.
     Stage One; One ship must reach the opponents start port to declare war.
     Stage Two, when two opposite ships are aligned, battle can commence.
     The two sea monsters play a big role in the game, they can obstruct ships, they can give moves and  they can give and take life points, depending on the dice.
     The winner is the player with the last ship/ships in the play arena.


—description from the designer

Name: CORONA NERVT!
Description:
At the beginning each player has 5 action cards, 5 coronas & 5 nerve cards in hand. Try to keep your nerve in this card game. You only have five of them at the beginning. In return, you should do everything you can to get rid of the coronas. Whoever got rid of all of their coronas first wins the game.

There are 60 action cards in the game. One action card is played per round. If you demonstrate strategic skill, you win the card game at the end.

As soon as a player falls below 0 nerve cards, he is eliminated. So you always have to have at least one of these nerve cards in hand.

When it is your turn, you have the option of using your action cards to have an effect on all players or only on a certain player - you can assign them even more coronas or take away nerves. After you have played an action card, you draw a new one. You continue to play until the stack of cards is used up or a player has already got rid of all his coronas or all others have lost their nerve.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Bei CORONA NERVT! starten alle MitspielerInnen mit 5 Nerv-, 5 Corona- und 5 Spielkarten. Die Aufgabe ist es nun Coronas loszuwerden, dabei die Nerven beisammenzuhalten und dies mit den eigenen Spielkarten geschickt zu steuern.

Wenn mich beispielsweise meine MitspielerInnen besuchen, setzen wir uns alle einem bewussten Risiko aus und erhalten daher alle eine Coronakarte und müssen eine Nervkarte abgeben. Nur nicht die Nerven verlieren und Corona wieder loswerden. Das ist die Strategie!

Es ist doch echt frustrierend, da hat schon wieder jemand beim Niesen nicht den Ellenbogen davorgehalten und im Bus trägt der Sitznachbar die Maske unter der Nase! Zack wieder drei Coronas gesammelt und drei Nerven verloren. Aber da! Ein Lichtblick! Impfstofflieferung in Sicht und endlich Sommer!

Ein schnelles Spiel in dem man nicht nur die eigenen Karten im Blick behalten muss, sondern auch die der MitspielerInnen. Kann ich mit der nächsten Karte eine/n MitspielerIn rausschmeißen? Wer ist fast geheilt und braucht dringend mal wieder eine Schippe Corona? Werde deine Coronas los, behalte die Nerven und bring die anderen zur Verzweiflung.

Dieses spannende Spiel, versüß die Zeit nicht nur im Lockdown und lässt uns über Corona und seine Auswirkungen auch mal schmunzeln!

Wer gute Nerven beweist und alle eigenen Coronas besiegt, gewinnt das Spiel. Wir sagen DANKE Jana!!

Name: Forge of Nations: The Strategy Card Game
Description:
A history-themed card drafting and city building game commemorating two hundred years of Singapore's history.

Player starts with a jungle, and your job is to grow it to a village, town and towards a city.

This can be done through growing the four developmental pillars of your settlement: Population, Economy, Governance, Infrastructure. During your turn, you can a) build your settlement, b) trade with fellow players or c) cause crisis situations to them. Grow your settlement while watching out for your rivals. First player to build the city wins.

Depending on the specific pillars you draft and build, grow your city to either a hippie tourism spot, economic bustling city with governance, or offshore gambling den... the possibilities of your settlement are endless!

Name: Nearly Heroes
Description:
A new arena has just been opened to the public and needs groups of brave participants willing to test their mettle and skill in the arts of combat.
Defeat all your enemies and receive ultimate glory as Heroes of the Land. Should you fail, worry not, you will be remembered as Nearly Heroes.

Nearly Heroes is a cooperative game where you and your friends compete in an arena against exotic enemies. The only thing is that our Heroes aren’t quite heroes. None of them are trained or skilled enough to wield the weapons they come across and suffer greatly for their misuse.
They’ve gotten in way over their heads and it’s up to you to lead them to victory together through strategy and a heavy dose of luck.

Name: Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice
Description:
Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice is a fast-paced naval miniatures wargame set in a DaVinci inspired ice age.

The planet has frozen over.  
Gale-force winds howl across the ice as you maneuver your ice skiffs to dominate the frigid domain.  
Based on ships of the line style naval games, Seas of Ice plays much, much faster.

A two-player game with half a dozen ships can be played out in about 30 minutes.  
A six-player game with 20 to 30 boats can run for an afternoon on a kitchen table.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Kingly Fight: The Battle of Bouvines, July 27, 1214
Description:
“The knights and the auxiliaries, armed and arranged into ordered echelons, prepared in all haste for the battle. The horses’ bridles were tightened by the auxiliaries. The armour shone in the splendor of the sun and it seemed that the light of day was doubled. The banners unfolded in the winds and offered themselves to the currents; they presented a delightful spectacle to the eyes.” –comment by the author of the Relation Marchianensis de Pugna Bovinis on the French army’s preparation for battle.

Following the Third Crusade tensions among the monarchs of Western Europe was at a new high. Otto IV, King of Portugal and newly crowned Holy Roman Emperor was facing revolt in the German provinces, many of whom were actively supported by the French King, Philip II, The Emperor had also garnered the enmity of Pope Innocent III soon after he was crowned when Otto claimed the Kingdom of Sicily, which he then attacked in 1209, which caused the Pope to excommunicate him. English King, John, was also involved with a growing conflict with the French, who were steadily taking lands along the border with Normandy. Indeed, John had only recently assumed the thrown following the death of his older brother, Richard (the Lionhearted) during a siege to retake one of the castles the French had captured earlier while the English king was on crusade. Tensions boiled over to outright war when the Pope authorized King Philip to launch a crusade against the upstart Holy Roman Emperor and his allies. The Battle of Bouvines, fought near the city of Tournai, was one of the largest ever fought in the Medieval period, and its outcome would affect the course of history for centuries.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the designer

Name: You Decide
Description:
Our debut game, You Decide, is a roll and move game full of choices!  With each move, You Decide which choice gives you the best chance of getting your pawns to Finish, first!  Sometimes your choice involves moving an opponent back!  Really want to make things interesting?  Play the optional "Snake Eye Switch" where you get to switch places with an opponent, and vice versa!

A single You Decide game is for 2 players, but have your guests bring their You Decide game and add up to two more players per game, laying the boards side by side for the ultimate party game!

Will your decisions make YOU the WINNER?

—description from the publisher

Name: Aus der Zeit des großen Königs
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Airplane Race
Description:
The objective of the game is to be the first to get his/her whole field cleared of planes. Each player takes turns spinning a spinner and clearing a hangar of his/her plane which number the spinner lands on. The first to clear all six planes win.

—user summary

Name: Die goldene Gans
Description:
